title: During which periods did the emperors of Japan wield the most personal power? - Quora

response.answer_text: August 1945, when the Showa Emperor Hirohito instructed his government to accept the Potsdam Declaration and stop fighting. Sorry, Dave, but building a temple doesn't hold a candle to ending a global war.

I think that the most powerful Emperor in Japan history was Emperor Shomu, ruled 724 to 749, who oversaw the building of the Todaiji temple in Nara, where the Great Buddha is still housed today. This was a national project equivalent to the Pyramids in grandeur.  The Great Buddha (Daibutsu) in the main hall  Great Buddha Hall (daibutsuden), a National Treasure The Shosoin, a wooden storehouse built to house the gifts presented to Emperor Shomu, from both Japan and abroad, is also a remarkable testament to his power. (This structure is also still available for viewing.) Shosoin Repository
